profileAlternative.name: Edward Kmett
profileAlternative.headline: Research Engineer at Machine Intelligence Research Institute
profileAlternative.summary: I spent most of my adult life trying to build reusable code in imperative languages before realizing I was building castles in sand. I converted to Haskell in 2006 while searching for better building materials. I now chair the Haskell core libraries committee, collaborate with hundreds of other developers on over 200 projects on github, and I am obsessed with finding better tools so that seven years from now I won’t be stuck solving the same problems with small variations on the same tools I was stuck using seven years ago.

aboutAlternative.text: I spent most of my adult life trying to build reusable code in imperative languages before realizing I was building castles in sand. I converted to Haskell in 2006 while searching for better building materials. I now chair the Haskell core libraries committee, collaborate with hundreds of other developers on over 200 projects on github, and I am obsessed with finding better tools so that seven years from now I won’t be stuck solving the same problems with small variations on the same tools I was stuck using seven years ago.

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description: Worked as the language engineering development lead for the DAML smart contract language.

positions.title: Sr. Software Engineering Lead
positions.description:
Designed and implemented scalable techniques for processing streaming data including portfolio attribution and factor backtesting.

Designed and implemented the lazy, pure Haskell-like functional programming language Ermine in both Scala and Haskell for use in report generation inside of ClariFI and the larger Capital IQ ecosystem.

I also do a great deal of community outreach to the Haskell and Scala communities. I chair the Haskell core libraries committee, run Boston Haskell, sit on the committee and run the Google Summer of Code for haskell.org, and maintain over 100 open source projects that are beneficial to both the open source community at large and S&P Capital IQ in particular, including the "monad transformer library" for Haskell and I help maintain "scalaz" the standard library for functional programming in Scala.
…
see more

positions.title: Raytheon Site Lead
positions.description:
Managed the software engineering team for SM&A.

Implemented the earned value management system (EVMS) dashboard and data warehouse for Raytheon's National and Theater Security Programs through the one|IDE SharePoint environment.

Devised novel techniques for analyzing earned value management data to determine when programs are trying to make their numbers look good for the end of quarter, at the expense of the critical path.

positions.title: Lead Software Engineer
positions.description:
Designed and prototyped a common infrastructure and interface for two NSF funded projects:

National Science Foundation Grant for Multi-Tree: A Digital Library of Language Relationships. BCS-04040000.

National Science Foundation Human and Social Dynamics Grant: LL-MAP: Language and Location, a Map Annotation Project. HSD 0527512

positions.title: Lecturer
positions.description: Taught courses in computer science from the college freshman to senior level.

positions.title: Consultant
positions.description:
MichTel Communications, LLC. is a phone company that was started while I was at mich.com, and which was part of BigNet Holdings. I returned as the senior software engineer to help address the needs of a growing organization that found itself under new management. I extended our billing and accounting system to support direct billing for DSL customers and to allow them to resell AOL/Time Warner Cable.
…
see more

positions.title: Systems Engineer
positions.description: Developed drivers for a holographic autostereoscopic computer display system that enabled the LifeVision 3D system to interact with commercial off the shelf software.

positions.title: Chief Information Officer
positions.description:
Managed 100+ employees across software engineering, network engineering, security and technical support for a nationwide DSL provider. Extended the system from mich.com (by this time a wholly owned subsidiary) to use XML and SOAP to automatically provision service from DSL providers Covad, SBC, and Rhythms along with our own CLEC DSL offering. Designed websites for Microsoft, Boeing and Marvel Comics.
…
see more

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Designed, implemented and maintained a web based billing, accounting and automated service provisioning system for a regional ISP and phone company that used techniques now known as AJAX to craft a more responsive user interface.

given.text: Ed was an excellent coworker to have on the team and my original inspiration for joining Clarifi. I look forward to working with him again in the future.
Ed is an outstanding person to work for. He gave me my first shot at software development, and taught me quite a bit. He was always a wealth of knowledge, and a valuable asset to our company.
Ed is extremely intelligent, up-to-date, and full of creative ideas. If you need an idea man, you won't be disappointed.

received.text:
I worked with Eli on two projects: an in-house lazy functional programming language, and a portfolio analytics engine we use here at ClariFI.

Eli had no difficulty covering the broad range of technical issues that arose from each of these very different spaces and was highly self-motivated.

I was quite sad to see him leave to further his education, and would very happily work with him again.

Dan is incredibly self-motivated and hard working. During his time at Big Net he quickly rose from tier 1 technical support to the technical support manager, passing many peers hired before himon the way. Finding himself insufficiently challenged, he taught himself enough about software development -- from scratch! -- that I was more than happy to help him transition into software engineering, a role that suited his keen problem solving skills and attention to detail.

Research Affiliate, Centre for the Governance of AI, Oxford
Executive Director at Center for Applied Rationality
